1â†’name: Claude Orchestrator

    53â†’      - name: Claude Analysis
    54â†’        id: analyze
    55â†’        env:
    56â†’          CLAUDE_CODE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN }}
    57â†’          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
    58â†’        run: |
    59â†’          cat > analyze.py << 'EOF'
    60â†’          import os

    62â†’          import yaml

    65â†’          from anthropic import Anthropic
    66â†’

    68â†’              results = {
    69â†’                  'security_issues': [],

    75â†’
    76â†’              # Security scan
    77â†’              try:
    78â†’                  bandit_result = subprocess.run(

    80â†’                      capture_output=True,
    81â†’                      text=True
    82â†’                  )
    83â†’                  if bandit_result.returncode != 0:
    84â†’                      security_data = json.loads(bandit_result.stdout)
    85â†’                      results['security_issues'] = security_data.get('results', [])[:5]
    86â†’              except:
    87â†’                  pass
    88â†’
    89â†’              # Ansible best practices
    90â†’              ansible_files = list(Path('.').glob('**/*.yml')) + list(Path('.').glob('**/*.yaml'))
    91â†’              for file in ansible_files[:10]:  # Limit to 10 files
    92â†’                  try:
    93â†’                      with open(file) as f:
    94â†’                          content = f.read()
    95â†’                          # Check for common issues
    96â†’                          if 'shell:' in content or 'command:' in content:
    97â†’                              results['best_practice_violations'].append({
    98â†’                                  'file': str(file),
    99â†’                                  'issue': 'Using shell/command instead of modules'
   100â†’                              })
   101â†’                  except:
   102â†’                      pass
   103â†’
   104â†’              # Generate recommendations
   105â†’              anthropic = Anthropic(api_key=os.environ['CLAUDE_CODE_TOKEN'])
   106â†’
   107â†’              prompt = f"""Analyze these repository issues and provide recommendations:
   108â†’              Security Issues: {len(results['security_issues'])}
   109â†’              Best Practice Violations: {len(results['best_practice_violations'])}

   112â†’

   125â†’              print(f"::set-output name=issues_found::{len(results['security_issues']) + len(results['best_practice_violations'])}")

   170â†’
   171â†’              ### ğŸ’¡ Recommendations
   172â†’              ${{ steps.analyze.outputs.recommendations }}
   173â†’
   174â†’              ### ğŸ”§ Automated Actions
   175â†’              - [x] Security scan completed

   181â†’

   195â†’  security-scan:
   196â†’    needs: claude-orchestrate
   197â†’    if: always()

   199â†’
   200â†’    steps:

   202â†’        uses: actions/checkout@v4

1â†’name: Claude Deploy
     2â†’
     3â†’on:
     4â†’  issue_comment:
     5â†’    types: [created]
     6â†’  workflow_dispatch:
     7â†’    inputs:
     8â†’      environment:
     9â†’        description: 'Environment to deploy to'
    10â†’        required: true
    11â†’        type: choice
    12â†’        options:
    13â†’          - development
    14â†’          - staging
    15â†’          - production
    16â†’      playbook:
    17â†’        description: 'Playbook to run'
    18â†’        required: true
    19â†’        default: 'site.yml'
    20â†’
    21â†’permissions:
    22â†’  contents: read
    23â†’  issues: write
    24â†’  pull-requests: write
    25â†’  deployments: write
    26â†’  actions: write
    27â†’
    28â†’jobs:
    29â†’  claude-deploy:
    30â†’    if: |
    31â†’      github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' ||
    32â†’      (github.event_name == 'issue_comment' && contains(github.event.comment.body, '@claude deploy'))
    33â†’    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    34â†’    environment: ${{ github.event.inputs.environment || 'development' }}
    35â†’
    36â†’    steps:
    37â†’      - name: Checkout repository
    38â†’        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    39â†’
    40â†’      - name: Setup Python
    41â†’        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    42â†’        with:
    43â†’          python-version: '3.11'
    44â†’
    45â†’      - name: Install Ansible
    46â†’        run: |
    47â†’          pip install ansible ansible-lint
    48â†’          ansible-galaxy collection install community.general
    49â†’
    50â†’      - name: Parse Deployment Request
    51â†’        if: github.event_name == 'issue_comment'
    52â†’        id: parse
    53â†’        env:
    54â†’          COMMENT_BODY: ${{ github.event.comment.body }}
    55â†’        run: |
    56â†’          # Extract environment and playbook from comment
    57â†’          if [[ "$COMMENT_BODY" =~ deploy[[:space:]]+([a-z]+)[[:space:]]+([a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+) ]]; then
    58â†’            echo "environment=${BASH_REMATCH[1]}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    59â†’            echo "playbook=${BASH_REMATCH[2]}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    60â†’          else
    61â†’            echo "environment=development" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    62â†’            echo "playbook=site.yml" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    63â†’          fi
    64â†’
    65â†’      - name: Create Deployment
    66â†’        id: deployment
    67â†’        uses: actions/github-script@v7
    68â†’        with:
    69â†’          script: |
    70â†’            const environment = '${{ steps.parse.outputs.environment || github.event.inputs.environment }}';
    71â†’            const deployment = await github.rest.repos.createDeployment({
    72â†’              owner: context.repo.owner,
    73â†’              repo: context.repo.repo,
    74â†’              ref: context.sha,
    75â†’              environment: environment,
    76â†’              auto_merge: false,
    77â†’              required_contexts: [],
    78â†’              description: 'Claude automated deployment'
    79â†’            });
    80â†’            return deployment.data.id;
    81â†’
    82â†’      - name: Run Pre-flight Checks
    83â†’        run: |
    84â†’          # Syntax check
    85â†’          ansible-playbook --syntax-check ${{ steps.parse.outputs.playbook || github.event.inputs.playbook }}
    86â†’
    87â†’          # Lint check
    88â†’          ansible-lint ${{ steps.parse.outputs.playbook || github.event.inputs.playbook }} || true
    89â†’
    90â†’      - name: Deploy with Ansible
    91â†’        env:
    92â†’          ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING: false
    93â†’          ANSIBLE_INVENTORY: inventory/${{ steps.parse.outputs.environment || github.event.inputs.environment }}/hosts
    94â†’        run: |
    95â†’          # Run in check mode first
    96â†’          ansible-playbook -i $ANSIBLE_INVENTORY \
    97â†’            --check \
    98â†’            ${{ steps.parse.outputs.playbook || github.event.inputs.playbook }}
    99â†’
   100â†’          # If check mode passes, run actual deployment (commented for safety)
   101â†’          # ansible-playbook -i $ANSIBLE_INVENTORY \
   102â†’          #   ${{ steps.parse.outputs.playbook || github.event.inputs.playbook }}
   103â†’
   104â†’      - name: Update Deployment Status
   105â†’        if: always()
   106â†’        uses: actions/github-script@v7
   107â†’        with:
   108â†’          script: |
   109â†’            const deployment_id = ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.result }};
   110â†’            const status = '${{ job.status }}';
   111â†’
   112â†’            await github.rest.repos.createDeploymentStatus({
   113â†’              owner: context.repo.owner,
   114â†’              repo: context.repo.repo,
   115â†’              deployment_id: deployment_id,
   116â†’              state: status === 'success' ? 'success' : 'failure',
   117â†’              environment: '${{ steps.parse.outputs.environment || github.event.inputs.environment }}',
   118â†’              description: `Deployment ${status}`
   119â†’            });
   120â†’
   121â†’      - name: Post Deployment Report

input.content:
# Setup Claude Code API Keys in GitHub

## Required GitHub Secrets

You need to add these secrets to your GitHub repository:

### 1. `CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN` (Required)
This is your Claude API key from Anthropic.

**How to get it:**
1. Go to https://console.anthropic.com/
2. Navigate to API Keys section
3. Create a new API key
4. Copy the key (starts with `sk-ant-api03-`)

**How to add to GitHub:**
```bash
# Using GitHub CLI
gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN

# Or manually:
# 1. Go to your GitHub repo
# 2. Settings â†’ Secrets and variables â†’ Actions
# 3. Click "New repository secret"
# 4. Name: CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN
# 5. Value: [paste your Claude API key]
```

### 2. `CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN` (Optional)
Used by some sync workflows. Can be the same as OAUTH_TOKEN.

```bash
gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN
```

## Quick Setup Script

Run this to set up both secrets at once:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

echo "Setting up Claude API keys for GitHub workflows"
echo "================================================"
echo ""
echo "You'll need your Anthropic API key from:"
echo "https://console.anthropic.com/account/keys"
echo ""
read -p "Enter your Claude API key (sk-ant-api03-...): " CLAUDE_KEY

# Set the secrets
echo "Setting CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN..."
echo "$CLAUDE_KEY" | gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN

echo "Setting CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN..."
echo "$CLAUDE_KEY" | gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN

echo ""
echo "âœ… Secrets configured successfully!"
echo ""
echo "To verify:"
echo "gh secret list"
```

## Verify Setup

After adding the secrets, verify they're working:

```bash
# List all secrets (won't show values)
gh secret list

# Test a workflow that uses Claude
gh workflow run claude-orchestrator.yml --field action=full-audit

# Check workflow status
gh run list --workflow=claude-orchestrator.yml
```

## Workflows That Use Claude API

These workflows will now work with your API key:

1. **claude-orchestrator.yml** - Main automation hub
2. **claude-code.yml** - Code analysis and fixes
3. **claude-autofix.yml** - Automatic issue resolution
4. **claude-code-review.yml** - PR reviews
5. **claude.yml** - General Claude integration

## Test Commands

Once configured, test with these PR/issue comments:

- `@claude review` - Trigger code review
- `@claude auto-fix` - Generate fixes
- `@claude merge` - Auto-merge if approved
- `@claude deploy staging` - Deploy to staging

## Troubleshooting

If workflows fail:

1. Check secret is set: `gh secret list`
2. Verify API key is valid at console.anthropic.com
3. Check workflow logs: `gh run view`
4. Ensure you have API credits/usage available

## Cost Considerations

- Claude API calls cost money based on tokens used
- Monitor usage at: https://console.anthropic.com/usage
- Consider setting spending limits in Anthropic console

input.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Setup Claude API secrets for GitHub workflows
set -e

echo "ğŸ¤– Claude API GitHub Setup"
echo "=========================="
echo ""
echo "This script will configure your Claude API key as GitHub secrets"
echo "for all the automation workflows."
echo ""
echo "You'll need your API key from: https://console.anthropic.com/account/keys"
echo ""

# Check if gh CLI is installed
if ! command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
    echo "âŒ GitHub CLI (gh) is not installed."
    echo ""
    echo "Install it with:"
    echo "  brew install gh                    # macOS"
    echo "  sudo apt install gh                # Ubuntu/Debian"
    echo "  sudo dnf install gh                # Fedora"
    echo ""
    echo "Or visit: https://cli.github.com/"
    exit 1
fi

# Check if authenticated
if ! gh auth status &> /dev/null; then
    echo "âŒ Not authenticated with GitHub CLI."
    echo ""
    echo "Run: gh auth login"
    exit 1
fi

# Get current repo
REPO=$(gh repo view --json nameWithOwner -q .nameWithOwner 2>/dev/null || echo "")
if [ -z "$REPO" ]; then
    echo "âŒ Not in a GitHub repository."
    echo "Make sure you're in the repository directory."
    exit 1
fi

echo "Repository: $REPO"
echo ""

# Check for existing secrets
echo "Checking existing secrets..."
EXISTING_SECRETS=$(gh secret list --json name -q '.[].name' 2>/dev/null || echo "")

if echo "$EXISTING_SECRETS" | grep -q "CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN"; then
    echo "âš ï¸  CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN already exists"
    read -p "Do you want to update it? (y/n): " UPDATE_TOKEN
    if [[ ! "$UPDATE_TOKEN" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
        echo "Keeping existing token."
        SKIP_OAUTH=true
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "Enter your Claude API key (starts with sk-ant-api03-...)"
echo "Get it from: https://console.anthropic.com/account/keys"
echo ""
read -s -p "API Key: " CLAUDE_KEY
echo ""

# Validate key format
if [[ ! "$CLAUDE_KEY" =~ ^sk-ant-api03- ]]; then
    echo ""
    echo "âš ï¸  Warning: Key doesn't start with 'sk-ant-api03-'"
    echo "Make sure you're using a valid Claude API key."
    read -p "Continue anyway? (y/n): " CONTINUE
    if [[ ! "$CONTINUE" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
        exit 1
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "Setting GitHub secrets..."

# Set CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN
if [ -z "$SKIP_OAUTH" ]; then
    echo -n "Setting CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN... "
    echo "$CLAUDE_KEY" | gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN
    echo "âœ…"
fi

# Set CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN (same as oauth token)
echo -n "Setting CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN... "
echo "$CLAUDE_KEY" | gh secret set CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN
echo "âœ…"

echo ""
echo "âœ… Secrets configured successfully!"
echo ""
echo "Verifying setup..."
gh secret list | grep CLAUDE || true

echo ""
echo "ğŸš€ Ready to use Claude workflows!"
echo ""
echo "Test with these commands:"
echo "  gh workflow run claude-orchestrator.yml --field action=full-audit"
echo "  gh workflow run claude-code.yml"
echo ""
echo "Or trigger via PR comments:"
echo "  @claude review"
echo "  @claude auto-fix"
echo "  @claude merge"
echo ""
echo "Monitor API usage at: https://console.anthropic.com/usage"
